subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Voice inflections?
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_01BF_01CA36E0.6BAB8EE0
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

I would definitely call that proof. The strength of the proof is in the par=
t that you knew nothing about what the message would mean to the person, or=
 if it a message for you, it was some fact that you had not known prior.

I=
MO, in this case there is no way it would be a case matrixing or hearing wh=
at you wanted or expected to hear, that it was real information conveyed th=
rough an intelligent source.

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: bulle=
tbabea 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Wednesday, September 16, 200=
9 2:46 PM
  Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: Voice inflections?


    I think quite o=
ften when the message isn't for me and it's for someone outside of this res=
earch it matters very much that the message is something I myself would nev=
er know. It hits home so much more for the recipient. To me it may seem dum=
b or meaningless but to the person who the message is for it can have a dee=
per impact because they know theres no way possible I could know the info. =
And vice versa when the message is for me sometimes the info doesnt become =
clear til much later down the road when I learn that bit of info or watch t=
hat predictive message become reality. It's all very interesting and educat=
ional =3D)

  Misty

  --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "April Abercrombie" =
<april@...> wrote:
  >
  > The only way to prove 100% that something you re=
ceive through the box is authentic communication, is if they say something =
that you can verify, something you yourself did not know.
  > 
  > ----- Or=
iginal Message ----- 
  > From: Misty Dawn 
  > To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com=
 
  > Sent: Wednesday, September 16, 2009 3:41 AM
  > Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC=
] Voice inflections?
  > 
  > 
  > I have gotten many life like voices over=
 the years. My first evp was my mothers voice and no boxes were involved. T=
he box is a tool/method and there are many ways to get their voices heard. =
So in the different methods I have used, yes I have heard voices that resem=
ble their lifetime charachteristics and tones. Is it always that way? No. 
=
  > 
  > Most often the group will speak as one voice because I have reques=
ted they do so. One voice tone will begin a sentence and another will end i=
t. So I may hear my female friends voice start off a thought and an unknown=
 male voice finish the sentence. And vice versa often they speak in tones w=
hich do not even come close to what they sounded like in life. Quite often =
they are spirits I didnt know in life. I may get someone saying This is edi=
son, and then find an old recording he did where he starts it off saying Th=
is is edison, but for me I do not know the man so there is no recognition f=
or me. I document it and file it away as a curiousity.
  > 
  > I always la=
ugh when people say thats not your mother or friend thats something trying =
to fool you and mess with your head. I knew my mother longer than anyone an=
d its interesting that it is easier for those people to believe that its po=
ssible that something/someone else is speaking pretending to be my mother b=
ut its much harder for them to believe that quite possibly that really is m=
y mother keeping her promise to stay in touch after death. If one is possib=
le then so is the other. I tend to be stubborn in some respects in that I d=
ont instantly believe what anyone tells me whether living or not. If they g=
ive me a message I think is dumb I am very reluctant to pass it on and usua=
lly those are the ones that get the biggest confirmations tho it means noth=
ing to me at the time. So yes quite possibly evp work can be used the same =
as mediumship in missing persons cases.
  > 
  > For me tone of voice has g=
rown to mean nothing. It is a treat when they manage to come across soundin=
g as they did when in physical form here but I look beyond the tone of voic=
e. Often people get a childs voice and they become saddened by the thought =
that a child is earthbound. But I see it just as a representation of voice =
and whether it comes across as male female child or robot matters little to=
 me.
  > 
  > I do find they often resume the "character" they played becau=
se after all that is sort of what we are, characters in some giant play. Wh=
ether it is the beliefs they had which were their trademark, the tone of vo=
ice, their image, or use of some nickname even I dont know about I look at =
it all as just a pixel in a larger portrait that some part survives once th=
e body has ceased to function. And the message is simply, our energy contin=
ues on.
  > 
  > Quote by Einstein: 'Energy cannot be created or destroyed,=
 it can only be changed from one form to another.'
  > 
  > Misty (the inso=
mniac is up way tooooo late and rambling on LOL)
  > 
  > --- On Tue, 9/15/=
09, mrscaptainjack2 <jjkamp@...> wrote:
  > 
  > 
  > From: mrscaptainjack2=
 <jjkamp@...>
  > Subject: [EVP-ITC] Voice inflections?
  > To: EVP-ITC@yah=
oogroups.com
  > Date: Tuesday, September 15, 2009, 9:56 PM
  > 
  > 
  > 
=
  > I was googling about AM radio reception, and I came across the below ex=
change on a forum. It talks about using the box to find missing persons (wh=
ich I didn't know was possible), and the conversation mentions hearing spec=
ific voice inflections and recognizing a dead person's specific voice on th=
e box. My question is, do any of you get a recognizable voice? The voices I=
 get always sound robotic, although I do get clearly male or female voices.=
 
  > 
  > http://www.itcbridg e.com/forum/ view_topic. php?id=3D515& forum=
_id=3D 31
  >
